content:
TITLE: Creating a Conda Environment
DESCRIPTION: Creates a new conda environment named 'ecosystem' with Python 3.9.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
conda create --name ecosystem python=3.9
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Activating a Conda Environment
DESCRIPTION: Activates the conda environment named 'ecosystem'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
conda activate ecosystem
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Python Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Installs Python dependencies from requirements.txt file using pip.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a New Branch
DESCRIPTION: These commands create a new branch based on the main branch. This new branch will hold your changes for the pull request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git checkout main
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git branch new-branch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Switching to New Branch
DESCRIPTION: This command switches the current working branch to the newly created branch named `my-branch`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git checkout my-branch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning the Forked Repository
DESCRIPTION: This command clones the forked repository from GitHub to your local system. Replace `<your_user_name>` with your GitHub username.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone git@github.com:<your_user_name>/ecosystem.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Committing Changes
DESCRIPTION: This command commits the staged changes with a descriptive message.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git commit -m "message"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pushing Changes to GitHub
DESCRIPTION: This command pushes the local branch to your forked repository on GitHub. The `--set-upstream` flag sets up the tracking information between the local and remote branches.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git push --set-upstream origin new-branch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Changes to Commit
DESCRIPTION: This command adds the specified files to the staging area, preparing them for a commit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git add <files_you_changed>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Keeping Fork Up-to-Date
DESCRIPTION: This command adds the original Qiskit Ecosystem repository as an upstream remote. This allows you to fetch updates from the original repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git remote add upstream https://github.com/qiskit-community/ecosystem.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Merging Upstream Main Branch
DESCRIPTION: These commands checkout the main branch and merge the latest changes from the upstream/main branch into your local main branch.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git checkout main
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git merge upstream/main
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checkout Main Branch
DESCRIPTION: This command checks out the main branch in the target repository, preparing it for merging the pull request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git checkout main
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling Changes from Fork
DESCRIPTION: This command pulls the changes from the development branch in the forked repository. Replace `forkuser` with the GitHub username of the person who created the pull request and `forkedrepo` with the name of their forked repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git pull https://github.com/forkuser/forkedrepo.git my-branch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Merging Feature Branch
DESCRIPTION: This command merges the changes from the `newfeature` branch into the currently checked-out branch (which should be `main`).
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git merge newfeature
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pushing to Main
DESCRIPTION: This command pushes the updated main branch, including the merged feature, to the origin repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git push origin main
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Development Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Installs development dependencies from requirements-dev.txt file using pip.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
pip install -r requirements-dev.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Style Checks
DESCRIPTION: Executes style checks using tox and the 'lint' environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
tox -elint
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Black Formatter
DESCRIPTION: Runs the Black code formatter using tox and the 'black' environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
tox -eblack
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Python 3.9 Tests
DESCRIPTION: Runs tests using tox and the 'py39' environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
tox -epy39
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Standard Repository Tests
DESCRIPTION: Runs standard tests within the repository using manager.py. Requires the repository URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
python manager.py tests python_standard_tests <url_of_the github_repository> --python_version=py39 --run_name="standard"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Stable Qiskit Tests
DESCRIPTION: Runs tests against the stable version of Qiskit using manager.py. Requires the repository URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
python manager.py tests python_stable_tests <url_of_the github_repository> --python_version=py39 --run_name="stable"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Development Qiskit Tests
DESCRIPTION: Runs tests against the development version of Qiskit using manager.py. Requires the repository URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
python manager.py tests python_dev_tests  <url_of_the github_repository> --python_version=py39 --run_name="dev"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Coverage Tests
DESCRIPTION: Executes coverage tests using tox and the 'coverage' environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
tox -ecoverage
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fixing Black Violations
DESCRIPTION: Applies the Black code formatter to a specified file to fix style violations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
black <PATH_FILE_YOU_WANT_TO_FIX>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the Website
DESCRIPTION: Builds the website using tox and the 'website' environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
tox -ewebsite
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing CLI commands using Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to execute CLI commands using the `manager.py` script in the Qiskit Ecosystem project. The script acts as a runner for commands executed from GitHub Actions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/project_overview.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
python manager.py <CMD> <NAME_OF_FUNCTION_IN_MANAGER_FILE> <POSITIONAL_ARGUMENT> [FLAGS]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Ecosystem data for the website
DESCRIPTION: This command generates ecosystem data from TOML files using the `tox` environment. It creates an `ecosystem.json` file and an `index.html` redirect file for the ecosystem webpage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/project_overview.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
tox -e website
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Forking the Repository
DESCRIPTION: This command shows the URL of the Qiskit Ecosystem repository on GitHub that needs to be forked for contributing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qiskit/ecosystem/blob/main/docs/git-guidance.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
https://github.com/qiskit-community/ecosystem
```
